website_summaries.verdict: A good compact ionic dryer that's easy to travel with.
pros: Nano titanium technology dries hair faster than normal
Helps reduce frizz and damage to hair
cons: Extreme heat can feel uncomfortable on the scalp

customer_reviews.title: This dryier works ok but I am a Big BaByliss ...
customer_reviews.text: This dryier works ok but I am a Big BaByliss fan and Im sorry to say this is NOT an Original. I have owned them and gifted them in the past and I knew immediately something was off with this one. There for Im sending it back. Original BaByliss have their Trademark logo on them and this one doesnt either
customer_reviews.author: M Cas

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I am a professional and it is very ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I am a professional and it is very light weight, not cumbersome. Heats up nice, but not too hot. Sometimes with the diffuser on it can warm up a little much, but on the whole I like it. I had to come back and edit this post, after using the blow dryer for over 6 months it is evident to me that there is a problem with the heating element. It does not get hot enough on the low setting but burns clients on the medium setting. Also, the diffuser does not stay on at all... Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Earl L.

customer_reviews.title: Will never blow dry my hair with Conair ever again.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first non Conair, non $20 blow dryer. Don't know how I lived so long using crap. This blow dryer blows a thick and steady heat. I don't know how to really describe it, but it is definitely way more effective than all the ones I've used before.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I never thought that the type of hair dryer you use could make such a difference! I have always blown my hair out and followed with a flat iron. I then read that for damaged hair, an ionic dryer is better because it doesn't just blast plain ole hot hair on your hair. I was skeptical, but needed to replace my old dryer anyway. I noticed a difference the very first time I used it, and was using all of the same products as before. My ends are not frizzy, and my hair dries quickly. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: DMC4810

customer_reviews.title: Hate this dryer
customer_reviews.text: My old dryer died and I loved that thing. My stylist friends recommended this to me and it doesn't do even half as good of a job as my old one. It takes longer to dry and leaves my hair looking frizzy and damaged at the end. I'm devastated because my old one is no longer sold and I'm left with a dryer I hate and distrust. Also, the diffuser does not stay on at all and falls off at any angle.
customer_reviews.author: MrsG

customer_reviews.title: Dryer heating element died after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one year ago and now the heating element has died - only blows cold air. VERY DISAPPOINTED IN POOR QUALITY OF PRODUCT. Too expensive to only last a year
customer_reviews.author: beebalm

customer_reviews.title: Xtava Black Orchid Diffuser
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes that it would fit my Xtava Black Orchid Diffuser, and it was a perfect fit! This is the best hair dryer I've ever used. The cord is super long, and the dryer is powerful. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: I Don't Recommend This
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a blow dryer where the medium temperature is so hot that it burns your hand. It's almost just as hot as the high temp selection. I get static everytime I use it regardless of the brush or products in my hair. Doesn't really dry well on the low because then it's too cool. I've had some $20-$30 Conairs that work better than this and don't burn my hair while using it. The buttons are in the way of getting a good grasp. I'm either turning it off or switching temp controls when using it. Definitely not worth the money. Wish I could return it. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: KimberMcC

customer_reviews.title: Flames started to come out of  blowdryer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these blowdryer a few months ago and it started to shoot out flames and caught on fire! Please beware with the usage of this blowdryer. It did work fine in the first couple of months or so but now I was completely shocked that fire was coming out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, light weight and works great
customer_reviews.text: I tried several mid/higher priced blow dryers at Ulta. Amazon's was cheaper. I like that it's lighter weight, the buttons aren't exactly where I'll accidentally turn it off and it's very efficient in getting my hair dry. I wish I were as patient as the stylist in really drying my hair in 2" sections (eye roll) but I'm not, so I need to be able to style it, dry so it doesn't frizz and be done! This does the job. Like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Khay

customer_reviews.title: FAKE/KNOCKOFF
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE BE AWARE!!️Fake/knockoff products are sometimes sold by and through Amazon. My blow dryer was not an original BaByliss Pro product. I know this because the logo on the dryer next to the signature “by BaBylissPRO” did not match the logo on the original that I recently saw at Ulta Beauty store. I also noticed that the tool did not get as hot as I expected, causing my hair not to get as straight. I was ripped off, paid $80 (the same price the real blow dryer costs) for a knockoff. I will not be ordering certain things from Amazon anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You will love this dryer!
customer_reviews.text: Believe all the hype this dryer is amazing! Worth the $70 I paid and will for sure be getting my daughter one for christmas. Powerful air without just being noisier. A lint cover that actually comes off so you can clean it and you definitely get the shine that others have commented about! Have used for 4 months now and extremely happy. Have long thick hair that used to take 20 minutes to fully dry before. Now we are done in less than 10.
customer_reviews.author: Thea A

customer_reviews.title: Hairdryer stopped working after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a great hairdryer for the first 8 months then started making a buzzing sound and stopped working. I'm trying to figure out how I go about returning this item for a replacement or refund but since I've had it for longer than 6 months it appears I cannot return it, despite the 3 year limited manufacturer warranty. The Amazon site makes returning broken items very difficult/impossible.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for curly girls
customer_reviews.text: This dryer is fantastic so far. I really love the 3 heat settings in addition to having a cold shot button, so I no longer have to just hold the cold the majority of the time. The dryer is slightly quieter than my chi dryer that I replaced for this. Also feels a bit more lightweight in the hands. And lastly, this dryer IS compatible with the xtava black orchid diffuser. I just had to put the diffuser down on a counter, and press the dryer on.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: 4 months isn't a quality product....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product via recommendation from a stylist that I know ... she uses it in her salon so I assumed it would be a quality item and last for a while. I do NOT have overly thick or overly styled hair, and probably use this about 5x per week. Today, the HIGH setting stopped working, UNLESS, I really push in the button with my finger as I use the product. This will NOT be able to be done for long, as it's a very uncomfortable way to do my hair, clearly!! I would be MORE than happy to send this product back for a return, or refund, but the refund window closed after just one month.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Kautz

customer_reviews.title: Biggest Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst hair dryer I have ever owned. It blows very little air out of it and, even though my hair is short, it takes two to three times longer to dry it than my last dryer. This dryer was highly recommended to me and I had never owned a BaByliss in the past. In no way would I ever recommend this dryer to a friend. I'm sorry I had to even give it one star.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I was highly disappointed with this blow dryer, which surprised me considering the rave reviews. Definitely NOT worth the almost 90 dollars...my old Conair is better! Made my hair have static and didn't dry it any faster then any other dryer I've used. My hair just didn't look right after using it. It will be returned this week.
customer_reviews.author: 💙BlackLabs215

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT Black Orchid Diffuser
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to see this hair dryer with great reviews and with the exact diffuser I have, so I went ahead and ordered it, but after it arrived, I could not get it attached to my diffuser and no it wasn't user error. With the diffuser completely intact the opening was too small, with the inner ring removed, the opening was too big. I'm not sure which manufacturer changed the size of their product, but they are no longer compatible with each other.
customer_reviews.author: Rockcitydow

customer_reviews.title: Fits the DevaCurl Diffuser!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a light weight dryer with three heat controls plus a high and low option. That's perfect for my curly hair! Bonus: it fits the DevaCurl diffuser attachment like a dream!! I don't know that is dries my hair significantly faster, but my hair look less frizzy and I love the long cord. Very easy to travel with, easy to use, not too loud... Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Manley12

customer_reviews.title: I just hate it.
customer_reviews.text: For years I've used a cheap conair blowdryer. I wanted to get a new faster drying blowdryer so I bought this. Honestly very disappointed. First of all I do not get all the good reviews. It blows less than my old cheap one. It does get hot. I'll give it that. I gave it 3 stars reluctantly because it works. But, my main complaint is when I hold the blowdryer, I constantly turn it off. The button on the handle is a pain in the rear. I literally hate this blowdryer. So, I will put it in the guest bathroom. At least they will have something.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased at least 3 blow dryers in the past 4 years and they all break or don't move any air making it take forever to dry my hair. I read reviews and bought this. WOW. This is WORTH EVERY PENNY. My hair dries in less than 5 minutes, it is easy on my hands to hold, not too heavy, has a nice long cord and is easy to adjust heat/volume. I only wish I had purchased it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Lightest Hairdryer and Big Power
customer_reviews.text: Love this hairdryer! One of the lightest I've used but HUGE power! It also has lots of settings, which I need for my fine, thin hair. I've had it for about a year and no issues, still working great. The hi/med/low switches are easy to accidentally hit while drying your hair, but they're so easy to flip back that I don't even notice when I have to do it. Definitely worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Brantley

customer_reviews.title: Everyone wants to know what I've done to my hair.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this hair dryer for a week. I have NEVER paid this much for a hair dryer but recently I used my daughters (no idea what brand) & realized there is a HUGE difference. Hair dryers do NOT all work the same. Everyday this week someone has asked me, "did you cut your hair", "did you color your hair" and/or "what have you done to your hair". People think I have a hairdresser doing my hair while QUARANTINED! The only change I've made was drying my hair with this amazing hair dryer. It literally takes 6 minutes vs. 20 minutes to dry my hair now! LOVE LOVE LOVE my Babyliss Pro!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: best hairdryer I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Power settings: off, low, and high Heat settings: cool, low, medium, high This is one of the few hairdryers I've owned where there are four heat settings AND the four settings--cool, low, medium, and high--are actually exactly what you'd want them to be. Cool is no heat, low is low enough heat that you won't burn your skin or anything else if you put the hairdryer right up close. Medium and high are almost-burning and electric torch, respectively. Rocker switches don't feel flimsy (although I almost prefer the rocker switches on the Babyliss Tourmaline, which I've also used). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Nice - If you don't need a diffuser.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, except I bought the diffuser (BaBylissPRO Nano Titanium Universal Finger Diffuser) that is suppose to go with it, and it won't stay on it at all. Just flys off. I don't see one that will work on this.... and with my curly hair, I need one. I don't think I would have bought this one, had I known the accessories for it would not work, and were so limited.
customer_reviews.author: DebC

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I’m not really sure about this, is it a reject? Idk. I can’t tell that it dries my hair any faster, or makes it look any more lustrous than my $25 drier. It feels cheap and flimsy. However my daughter says it dries her hair faster.. I’m going to keep it because I spent 4 hours researching hair driers and I don’t have the energy to research more.. if it somehow blows my mind in the near future I will update this review!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Came back to it
customer_reviews.text: My first BaByliss stopped working after about five years so I opted for a cheaper one from Amazon. NOT! I came back to this one, which is tried and true. I don’t know if there are better or comparable “frizz fighting” dryers out there, and this one needs the help if a hair straightener, but I feel safe that my routine will give me the results I’m now used to. So, I’ll keep this dryer. If anyone has any suggestions for a better one, please let me know. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Tahia Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Purchased Jan 6, 2019 - Died this morning!
customer_reviews.text: I hope the company reaches out to me! My dryer died 1/2 way through this morning. It was super untimely... not only because I needed to be at work at 6:30am, I also am speaking to several new patients who will judge my appearance. I also have several events this weekend & going out to purchase a new dryer is/was not on my to do list - especially since my purchase was on Jan 6, 2019. How do we resolve this?
customer_reviews.author: Christie Ochs

customer_reviews.title: Quickest dry in town!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best hair dryer I’ve owned. I’ve got very thick long hair and I’ve had a cheapo Walmart hairdryer for 10 years. I’d spend well over an hour holding that thing and still never completely get dry hair. This was my Christmas present to myself on Black Friday and I’m happy to say it’s spectacular! Throwing away the old one! 5++++++ stars!
customer_reviews.author: Isabella L

customer_reviews.title: All blowdryers are NOT created equal!
customer_reviews.text: I used to joke about being terrible at blowdrying my hair. It would always come out insanely frizzy and not even remotely as nice as at the hair salon no matter how hard I tried. I finally decided to upgrade to a nice dryer and chose this one based on all the rave reviews. The multiple heat settings are great and my hair is super smoothe and tamed when I use it with a round brush. Im only docking one start off my rating because the nosal attachment gets really hot when in use. I nearly burned my ear using it the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Turns counters blue
customer_reviews.text: The dryer itself is okay, nothing great. The biggest problem is that I have white counter tops in my bathroom and just from setting it down on the counter, there are freaking blue streaks/spots and they aren’t coming out without extraneous scrubbing with bleach. It’s not being dropped on the counter, it’s not hitting with force so it should Never be leaving color on surfaces! My guess is that when it’s heated up after use and you set it down the color comes off because it’s hot? That is completely unacceptable, people pay lots of money for counters and shouldn’t have to worry about stains from a blow dryer! throwing it away and buying a different one ASAP
customer_reviews.author: merec

customer_reviews.title: Bummer!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this hair dryer. It makes my hair look gorgeous. So why the 3* review? Because it's a 16 amp dryer and I live in a house with 15 amp circuits. I just figured this out after blowing circuits all in almost every room and blaming my old house. Now I have to try and find a new dryer that works *nearly* as well. Somebody I know is gonna get a great hand-me-down. :(
customer_reviews.author: Sea Pony

customer_reviews.title: Better for my hair.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize my old hair dryer was terrible until I got this one. This is lighter, quieter, and less damaging to my hair. I bought this during COVID-19 lockdown so my hair wasn’t in the best shape. I was using this simply to dry my hair, since no styling is needed during quarantine. But, I noticed immediately that I wouldn’t even need a flat iron to take away the frizzy fly always that were usually left from my old dryer. I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I really do not like this dryer. The heat seating are great low, medium, and high. But the speed only has low and high, it would be nice if it had a medium. The high speed is to high and the low is lot enough. Then when I try to use the diffuser it falls off all the time. Definitely not worth the money. I have had better luck with a store bought dryer for a lot less money. i would not recommenced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I received my Bayliss Nano Titanium Dryer this morning and I couldn't wait to try it. I have been trying to let my hair grow out from a short pixie for about 8 months. I've had short hair for so long that I forgot how frizzy my hair is and how long it takes to blow dry. I have thick (a lot of hair) but I have fine wavy and FRIZZY hair. It did cut my drying time down but what I really loved is how smooth and healthy my hair looked after drying my hair. I am it one to spend 80$ for a hair dryer but day 1 I love it.
customer_reviews.author: diane westover

customer_reviews.title: I SO love my hair dryer!
customer_reviews.text: I am completely besotted with my Babybliss Pro! It dries my hair quickly and with less frizz. It's very light weight. The toggle switches are on the handle, where you hand naturally goes, so while it's easy to flip from high or low, it takes some getting used to not to turn if off accidentally. No big deal, though. Interesting note: a few days after I received and used my Babybliss, I had my regular appointment with my hair stylist. He has a similar,older model that he says he has had for several years. He says one of his favorite features is the weight. He says it's nice and light and easy for him to use all day.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeckyc

customer_reviews.title: Product did not hold up
customer_reviews.text: This dryer completely quit working in 4 months. Received it October 2, use it approximately 3 times a week and it has already stopped working. It looks brand new but will not turn on. My Amazon product warranty window “closed” on 12/31. I called The manufacturer and was advised it carries a “limited” warranty and that any return shipping costs must be paid by me and that I must also send a $5.00 check to cover their shipping cost. I paid $70.19 in October.
customer_reviews.author: L. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Best Blow Dryer
customer_reviews.text: Today I used to for the first time. It’s awesome. I used to have a $200 blow dryer and after a few years it broke. I didn’t want to spend that much on a blow dryer so I went on amazon and got a $50 blow dryer. Ugh waste of money. It was so loud , left my hair super frezzy. I was not happy. So I asked my hair dresser for a blow dryer that actually works without spending too much. He recommended this one. So I bought it and it works soo good. Dries your hair without freezy . It’s light and I really like how my hair felt. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, lightweight, compact but strong
customer_reviews.text: I love this hair dryer! I previously had a Hot Tools hairdryer (matte black Ulta exclusive) that I liked but died after a year and a half, so I’m hoping this one has a longer lifetime. This hair dryer is smaller, more lightweight, and much quieter than my previous dryer. I live in an apartment complex with thin walls, and I no longer feel guilty drying my hair late at night/ early in the morning, I’m actually surprised how quiet this dryer is. Despite it being quiet and lightweight, it really seems to dry my hair efficiently, and I have a lot of hair that takes a long time to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great dryer for daily use
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old hairdryer when I came across this product. Never heard of the brand before but thought I'd try it out. It works as advertised. It's about 10 decibels quieter than my old dryer (per my smartwatch) and it seems to dry my hair a bit faster. Granted, my old dryer was easily over 15 years old, so it did its job and technology has certainly improved in that time. I've used it for a couple of weeks now, no complaints. Due to its size, I'm not sure it would be great for travel, it is relatively light, however. At this point, I'd consider this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Tigger3370

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not for me
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product, just not the dryer for me. Here's my take: Not particularly lightweight but not bad; extremely quiet: great feature is the stand built into the fan area that allows the dryer to stand on the work surface; handle is at an odd angle for me; the buttons are in a place where I accidentally switch them while using; my fine, thin hair was more frizzy than with my last dryer. Overall: A good product, just not one that works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zan

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this blow drier so much oh my god . It has cut my blow drying time in half . And like I am Russian so I got thick hair . The watts on this is very great for the price and that it’s also light weight , that’s why I needed to replace my older one because it was heavy .
customer_reviews.author: Daria S

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Not very good.
customer_reviews.text: For over $80, I wish it was better. It does the job, but it just doesn’t feel very powerful. Only a slight upgrade from my $30 Remington dryer. OH and the orchid diffuser Amazon keeps suggesting for it DOES NOT FIT. DO NOT BUY IT. Something is really off here. Recent reviews of both items are weird- you can’t review the diffuser and amazon is only listing reviews from years ago for this dryer...
customer_reviews.author: Chloe R.

customer_reviews.title: Fast drying & less frizz! Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST hair dryer I've ever owned! I've only used it twice so far and I am so happy with my purchase! I love that it's lightweight, dries my hair faster, leaves my hair so soft, and drastically reduces my frizz. My hairdresser uses a $400 Dyson, and honestly, this dryer is not much different. My old dryer left my hair so frizzy, so I always had to follow up with a straightener (more heat and damage). Now I don't need to straighten every day if I don't want to. What a difference. My only regret is that I didn't buy it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas Gift Ever!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a notorious over buyer of presents. But don’t get jelous ladies we’re talking Sailor Moon and Deadpool shirts from Hot Topic and and a back massager from Walgreens. (True story- Christmas 2016) So this year I started an Amazon Wish List. Success! Well pretty much until he discovered my “shopping list”. But anyway this hairdryer is AMAZING!!!!! I have thick hair and drying it always leaves it frizzy. Not anymore! Well worth the price since I no longer have to straighten it or curl it if I don’t want too. It’s powerful but you don’t feel like your in a tornado. There are different heat settings and the cool blast is actually cool! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: MamaBearPlus3

customer_reviews.title: The nozzle falls off every time I use it regardless ...
customer_reviews.text: The nozzle falls off every time I use it regardless of how tightly I fit it on the dryer. It sounds and acts weak, it takes far more time to dry my hair than any other dryer I have ever owned. I am baffled at the $85.00 price. Save your money, buy something else, anything else.
customer_reviews.author: lisa scott

customer_reviews.title: Hot air is not all the same?!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was super skeptical about a more expensive "salon grade" blowdryer. Hot air is just hot air right? I was SO surprised to find out that this dryer is legitimately BETTER than my regular consumer grade blowdryer. I have long wavy hair that I like to style every so often. Washing my hair always needs to be planned since the drying and styling have in the past, taken a bit of time. This dryer cut my drying time down to HALF. That's right. HALF. And my hair actually looks shinier and feels healthier. Anything that saves time and improves on a necessary process at this price point is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: HHH

customer_reviews.title: Good Hair Dryer
customer_reviews.text: The last hair dryer was a GHD and only lasted about one year. I paid a lot of money for that hair dryer for it to go out so soon. My hairdresser recommend this brand. I had never heard of BaBliss & hot Tools. I had a hot tools in the past that did not last long. I have only had this hair dryer for about 2-3months but so far has been a good hair dryer. It does not blow as much air as others I've had but gets the job done in about the same amount of time so I'm good with that. It does not get real hot to damage your hair
customer_reviews.author: Radnurse

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased with it so far
customer_reviews.text: My old $20 dryer I bought at Target finally bit the dust after 10 years and my friend convinced me to invest in this dryer. After a month, I'm pleased with it so far. Be warned: the "high" temperature setting is no joke! Start with medium and go from there. Also, the Babyliss diffuser is not a good buy. It makes a horrible high-pitched whine when used with this dryer regardless of the dryer settings (even on low). It should come with ear plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Hottools dryer for about 10 years and finally had to get a new dryer. I have a lot of chemically treated hair, it’s curly and I always straighten it. I’ve never been able to style my hair without drying and flat ironing but I can with this dryer and it takes me half the time. Full disclosure I also bought a new round brush. That said my hair isn’t frizzy or kinky and I love my new dryer! I saw some reviews that the shelf life is short so I’ll look out for that.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Suddenly stopped heating
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for about 2 1/2 years, but only use it occasionally (I have curly hair and don’t blow it out often). At first I loved this hair blower - it was hot (maybe too hot?), comfortable and cut down drying time, but today - mid dry - it stopped heating. I thought I pushed the cool shot button by mistake, but no. No idea what’s going on. I would have expected a much longer life span for something that only gets used twice a month.
customer_reviews.author: N & T W

customer_reviews.title: Drys Fast
customer_reviews.text: This dryer is much better then my old dryer. I have very long hair and this dryer cuts down the time it takes to dry my hair. Still have to use a lot of product before drying my hair to keep from damaging my hair, but it is working much better and my hair is smoother, not as frizzy.
customer_reviews.author: S2000

customer_reviews.title: Felt cheap
customer_reviews.text: This hair dryer felt like a $20 Conair. It has a lightweight plastic feel and the fan sounds cheap. I may be spoiled after having an Elchim for five years. When that dryer died (the dryer itself was fine but the cord had a short in it) I thought I'd try something different. Bad move. I'm going to re-invest in another Elchim.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Heat settings to hot for fine hair
customer_reviews.text: I heard great things about this hairdryer on multiple websites, but I have very fine hair and the heat settings are too hot and burn my hair. The low heat setting is the same as a cool shot which is annoying and med heat setting is too strong. High heat seriously burns my hands. I am disappointed with this hairdryer. I've bought hairdryers in the past for a similar price and for slightly less that worked better than this one for my hair type. I would look elsewhere if you have fine hair.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Kleppin

customer_reviews.title: This is a great hairdryer, it works well and dries my hair ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hairdryer, it works well and dries my hair quickly. I don’t see a difference really between this one and a $25 dryer. I have always had cheaper hair dryers and decided that I would try a more expensive one to see if there is a difference. I have to say, I don’t see any difference at all. But that being said, this one works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen C

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to try to make this short and sweet. I have thick, medium length, naturally very curly hair. This hair dryer on the medium heat setting will straighten my hair completely smooth without needing a flat iron and not only that I don't get hot and sweaty because of the heat control. I know it's a little pricey but it's totally worth it to me because 1. It works and saves a ton of time 2. I don't get sweaty or burned from the heat 3. I no longer dread washing my hair because it's so easy to dry now. Get it, it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: My 3 Sons

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a new and better hair dryer, but I didn't want to spend too much. I usually buy cheaper ones and they will last about 2 yrs. I was willing to spend a little more for something that will last longer. Luckily prime day was coming up and I found this. Honestly if I knew how good it was before buying it I would've had no problem paying full price. It's lightweight, it dries faster than my old one, it makes my hair smoother and I like how the attachment goes on. You just push it on and it stays. Then you pull it off once it's cooled down. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Babybliss not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bot as powerful as I would like it to be. The attachment does not fit correctly, Do not even know if it is the right attachment it keeps on coming off no good very unhappy with the product for the price i had much better hair dryers at higher drying settings for way less with everything included wirh this babyliss over all...Not worth it! I would not buy this again very unhappy wiyh this ;~(
customer_reviews.author: 🌺🍃Jewels🍃🌺

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to use and frizzes my hair even with heat protectant and on low setting
customer_reviews.text: Do not like this brand. Second one I’ve ended up tossing. My hair frizzes even on a low heat setting and with heat protection products. Also the switches are in an awkward position so that I would accidentally turn it off in middle of drying.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sheets

customer_reviews.title: Dries Great
customer_reviews.text: Great dryer... works fast, setting are good and easy to hold. I also love that it has little "feet" at the bottom to set the dryer on instead of just putting it down while it is still running. That is important because when I am changing brushes or rolling up my hair the dryer doesn't fall off the countertop because it is still running. Other than that works great and I like a product that actually lives up to it's reviews!
customer_reviews.author: klip

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Kind of pricey for what it offers.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on the review in Good Housekeeping. It's a fine hairdryer but it's nothing special. Takes the same amount of time to dry my hair as my previous dryer did so I hardly consider this a powerful tool. My biggest peeve with it is the rocker style buttons that are situated right in the sweet spot of the handle which means you constantly bump them off mid-use. I would not recommend this dryer but if you can get it for a great price, it will do the job adequately for you.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Keeley

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful, almost too much
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once but I really like it so far. Only thing is it's very powerful. If you don't know what you're doing (like me) or have a sensitive scalp (also me) I wouldn't recommend going above the medium heat setting. It felt like my scalp was on fire lol. But on the plus side, it only took maybe 8 minutes for my hair to be fully dry and I have thick curly hair. Bonus: it also works well with the xtava black orchid hair diffuser I bought. You have to remove the inner ring on the diffuser to get it t seat properly but I promise it is possible.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Vincent

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP, Attachment blows right off the nozzle!
customer_reviews.text: First review on Amazon ever...this is so bad. Even on the lowest setting this hairdryer is HOT. Only one pro...it’s very light so your arm doesn’t get tired. HUGE con...the attachment only slides on the nozzle so even on low it will immediately blow off. There is no way to fasten this like my previous Babyliss which simply snapped on. Why even provide an attachment if it pops off as soon as you turn on the air?! I had to MacGyver it and tape it on. Do not buy this hairdryer. I am outside of the return window, but perhaps I can save someone from a regretful purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Gina M. Salomoni

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: I dropped and broke my my old dryer and was watching YouTube videos on options. I was originally going to buy the dyson dryer but there were too many reviews about it dying after 2 years and I wasn’t willing to take the risk since it’s $400. I love my babyliss straightener el I decided to give this a try. It leaves my hair very soft and it’s light weight. Hopefully it will last many years like my old one did.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dryer when my 10-year-old Revlon dryer finally quit working. I was excited to 'upgrade' at last. Unfortunately, I'm very disappointed. The focuser is way too hot to adjust while you're using the dryer. I could turn the focuser on my Revlon dryer and didn't realize that feature wasn't standard. Also, the focuser frequently falls off. That's irritating. On the plus side, the power-to-noise ratio is good - high power, but not unbearably loud.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Seriously the BEST
customer_reviews.text: Best hairdryer I've ever used and this is actually my second unit because the ex took the first one LOL. It's crazy lightweight, get's hot as hell and the air comes out harder than any blow dryer I've ever used.... like twice as hard. Had the first unit that was commandeered by the above mentioned person for 10 years and still going strong. This will likely be the last dryer you ever buy, it's that damn good.
customer_reviews.author: BAD BOY

customer_reviews.title: Best hair dryer for straightening/smoothing
customer_reviews.text: After two Hot Tools dryers bit the dust way too early, decided to switch to BaByliss Nano Titanium and wow - does this dryer make a huge difference for my hair. It straightens and smooths my naturally curly hair so well that it takes me half the time as it used to dry my hair, and often don't even need to use a flat iron to get it sleek and straight. This was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of twins

customer_reviews.title: User Error but the dryer is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I swear my drying time is cut in half. I love the feel of this in my hand and the cord is super long compared to my old dryer. I still can’t manage the frizz the way my guy in the salon does with his baby bliss but I’m sure it’s me not knowing how to use the brushes. Overall even though this is the most expensive dryer I have ever purchased I am glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: JStill

customer_reviews.title: Love this hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never put a lot of thought into buying a hair dryer. Just bought this one bc it had good reviews. But oh my goodness I love it. I have super dry hair but there is something about this dryer that keeps my hair more silky than normal! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: dries great
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a few times but it's so much better than my old hair dryer. I'm a no product girl, it's straight as a stick and nothing will help that so I've given that up. BUT..this hair dryer I think has actually made my hair look less fly away and brighter (think shiny). It's a full size dryer so not the one I will take on vacation, also weighs a pound. Heavier than my last drier but I'm not using it as long as this one dries so much better I haven't noticed that all that much. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PWentz65

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and fast drying
customer_reviews.text: I haven't spent much on hairdryers in the past and this is my most expensive one. I needed something to dry my hair faster. This one does the job and it doesn't leave it as frizzy as my other cheap one. My hair is wavy frizzy (I'm latina with rally dark and thin frizzy hair so...you figure it out, gotta style it) and I am surprised that just a hair dryer will make a difference. I don't have much experience with other expensive hair dryers so to me this is a big step up! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: This started to sputter and just died on me in two months. I am so disappointed. After calling Amazon they told me to just press the reset button and after waiting for 30 mins all I got was a phone number of Babyliss Customer service which I could have gotten online. They of course are not answering and just tells you to stay on the line for whk knows how long. IT'S BEEN 45 MINS. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I don't think anyone would want to have to be this stressed out over a hair dryer. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Seokmin Choi

customer_reviews.title: This dryer will blow you away!
customer_reviews.text: I asked my beautician for a recommendation and this brand was suggested. It is a a bigger investment but definitely seems better quality and performs much better than the cheaper ones I've owned in the past. It's high velocity setting really will dry even thick hair quickly. It comes with a director to place over the "nose" so you can concentrate the airflow in one area. It has a cool shot button and low, med, and high heat settings. It does seem to weigh more and be built far more solidly. Not only that, it is quieter than others I have used. Best dryer yet!
customer_reviews.author: canonwren

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Impressed Twice.... First of all I'm impressed that my husband picked this out all by himself for my birthday, he did a great job because I'm impressed how well this product works! My old blow dryer was ok but I've been missing out! Don't be thrown off by the price, whether you think it's too pricy or not pricy enough to work well you'd be wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Ertle

customer_reviews.title: Love this dryer
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this dryer does its job! It dries my hair faster. It does not leave my hair all frizzy like my old drier. Only thing I wish it had rubber stoppers on the sides so I could lay it down. You literally have to set it upright in order to set it down. If that makes sense. That's the only down fall. It's not a bad thing, you just have to get used to it. P.S., my daughter steals my drier at times and forgets to put it back!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Swearingen

customer_reviews.title: Warning.....
customer_reviews.text: AS much as I love this blow dryer I want to warn you!!!!! Yes I purchased this in 2017. But it lasted a year and since then I have purchased 2 more different BabyBliss models from other venders. First one the cord started sparking and died. The second two the motors sparked and started smoking. Why would I keep buying them? When they work there great but I cant keep buying $100 range dryers to die.
customer_reviews.author: Lark L.

customer_reviews.title: Really powerful, not too loud even on Hi, very useful settings and controls, extremely light for its size.
customer_reviews.text: Best portable jet engine EVER! Quiet, powerful and half the weight of the Babyliss PRO it replaces, which I've had for 12 years...I just love this thing. Light enough for my 8-year-old daughter to use easily, and on the Lo heat setting, will not burn her head no matter how hard she tries. The cord is perfect: not too thick, but not too thin, either. Two 'horns' on the rear allow it to be safely placed and used on a flat surface, like your sink counter, so you can have the air blow upwards and use two hands if you need to. Terrific hair dryer. Completely and totally worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: C. Goulet

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have thick colored hair, which used to be super healthy, but lately have always been dry, no matter what expensive conditioner I use... Well this hair dryer makes them more hydrated and shiny! It's much faster than any model I've ever had, and my hair are very long... It's light, not really loud, and have a long cord. That's exactly what I was looking for! I understand why someone complained about the heat: if your goal is to do complicated blowout maybe you shuld get something different, but since my priority is the health of my hair and to get ready quickly, this 2000w tourmalin ionic is just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Silvia Bottini

customer_reviews.title: Quiet hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this using a gift card that I earned through my work, other wise the would have deterred me. It does dry my hair quicker than my old dryer. As far as making my hair shiner...I do not believe that I have seen any impact to my shine. It is much quieter too which is nice. I always use the small attachment that came with it. Overall, yes it dries MUCH quicker but the price is a bit steep.
customer_reviews.author: ln2456

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews I was excited to purchase this dryer on sale. Unfortunately it has not lived up to the hype. It dries my hair and that's about it. The concentrator flies off when the dryer is heating and so far it has hit me in the ankles twice. The temperature and speed buttons are on the side of the handle and frequently when I grip the handle I change the settings by accident. The cord is extra long and tangles a lot even when I hang the dryer by the loop. Frankly I was happier with my cheap Conair. I do not recommend, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for normal use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this when my old hair dryer died and I love it. It’s the same one my stylist uses at the salon which made me pretty happy with the value. Plenty of adjustment to be made for power and heat preferences.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Update: Worst Purchase & Customer Service EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!! Made such a difference from my $20 conair cheap dryer.. My hair has never felt so soft, straight and healthy! Update: This was the worst blowdryer that I have ever bought. I purchased this from the Seller: Amazon and I have NEVER been more dissapointed in a purchase in my life. This thing stopped working after a month, it will only blow cold air. Thanks Amazon for the amazing product. I get the joy of blow drying my hair every day with cold air.. this take me twice as long and my hair looks terrible because it won't round brush straight. You would think amazon would respond to my emails about replacing the item. Worst Purchase EVER!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best investment!
customer_reviews.text: Who knew there was a difference in hair dryers? I could not believe how well this dried my thick, wavy hair and how good it looked when I dried it to straight using just this hair dryer and round brush! It was totally worth the extra money because now I only use this and no longer use a straightener or other styling items. Travels well. ** Special note **. I bought this item twice because the first one accidentally burned up in Europe (despite adapter and surge protector), so that's how much I like it - will NOT be taking the 2nd one abroad!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Peiffer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not amazing.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good blow dryer but I don't feel it's as amazing as reviews made me believe. I don't think it dries my hair faster or leaves it looking any better than the old blow dryer I got for 20.00 at Ross (which just died after 8 years). I don't think I'll splurge on a "nice" blow dryer again. I do like that the cool setting is actually gets cool.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Kind of does it's job, but nothing "Wow"about it
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally left my blowdryer behind during a trip. I ordered this BaBylissPRO BABNT5548 Nano Titanium Hair Dryer after reading the reviews. Unfortunately for me, it didn't work out as well as I would've liked. I have thick, frizzy hair. My Sedu, which I take everywhere, does a great job of drying my hair fast and makes it look smooth and healthy. This one took double the time and didn't really smooth my hair, instead it looked a little more damaged than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this hair dryer. It lasted 8 months and is already broke and of course it’s not eligible for return. As much as you pay for these, they should last longer than 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Shipp

customer_reviews.title: I hate this dryer
customer_reviews.text: I gotta tell you...I hate this dryer. I bought this dryer to replace an old Chi dryer and because it got great reviews. I very much regret this purchase. It claims to dry hair faster and leave hair shiny, smooth & silky. Many reviews back up this claim. I’ve found none of that to be true. Not only that, the concentrator nozzle constantly flies off which is beyond annoying. I won’t return this dryer since I’ve used it a few times, but I’ll be purchasing a Chi dryer as soon as I find a good deal on one or I lose my patience with this dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hair dryer in Feb 2016 and loved it until recently. It cut down on my drying time and my hair was smoother when I used it. It’s been struggling with power for the last 2 months and as of today it is done. Disappointed that it only lasted a little over a year and a half for the price that it is.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: and cool blast for the added shine at the end
customer_reviews.text: This dryer is worth every penny!! I can blow dry my hair without having to use high heat setting, which damages your hair. Plus the cooler setting keeps my hair from looking frizzy. It dries half the time of my old Conair dryer, cooler air, and cool blast for the added shine at the end. I LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.author: Spatt

customer_reviews.title: Makes a HUGE difference!
customer_reviews.text: It's taken me 46 years to realize a hair dryer makes a HUGE difference in the way your hair comes out in the mornings. I LOVE this dryer - my hair has so much more lift and volume after using this, and the drying time seems to be a lot faster than my old cheap Conair dryer. Plus, it's about 1/2 the price of the Dry Bar blow dryer which I was on the fence about getting due to its price tag of +/-$200. I purchased this one instead due to the cheaper price and the great reviews and am pleasantly surprised in how much of a difference it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa 1972

customer_reviews.title: Just died
customer_reviews.text: I loved this blow dryer, but is just died. Haven't even had it four years. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: I need costumer service attention
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after TWO uses. Looking for a replacement and/or refund from the company please!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Made In China
customer_reviews.text: I searched and searched for a blow dryer that was NOT made in China. This brand states that it is a product of Europe by design and engineering. That certainly may be true, but on the box it plainly states it is made in China. Since I could not find anything actually made outside of China I will be keeping it since it had good reviews and it does dry my hair adequately.
customer_reviews.author: Ks

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Invested in a Good Hair Dryer Years Ago
customer_reviews.text: I never knew hair dryers can be the culprit of drying out hair until reading some review about it, and now I agree! My hair was real frizzy using my previous hair dryer, with this one, I haven't even been straightening my hair afterword as I usually did. Dries my hair several minutes faster than my previous hair dryer. Its quiet, easy to turn on and adjust the settings, and easy to hold. Good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Domino

customer_reviews.title: Does not smooth out your hair
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to admit that I should have returned this expensive hair dryer before the return window closed. I like that it's so lightweight. That is a huge plus. But ... it just doesn't give the sleek look. I've tried it using it without hair product and also with a variety fo different products ... it just doesn't deliver on results.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys

customer_reviews.title: Not as happy as I thought I’d be
customer_reviews.text: I like the hairdryer. However, I’m finding after 8 months, it was starting to get hot at the handle. I realize it’s been that long but I feel for 85.00 and the reviews I read, it shouldn’t be doing this so soon. I’d like the seller to contact me.
customer_reviews.author: lynn bock

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Loved the light weight dryer,. A little too bulky for my traveling purposes. I returned this lovely dryer as I found that my frizzy tendency could not be tamed. My previous dryer gave a nice sheen, flat styling, tamed my frizz which this dryer was not able to duplicate. Unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: colavecd

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Dries hair quickly with its choice of three heat settings PLUS cool shot, and two air speeds. The dryer is lightweight, and easy to handle while drying your hair. It comes with a directional concentrator for straightening hair with a big round or a paddle brush. This is my first non $20 cheapo discount store hairdryer, and I will never ever go bac&
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! Nothing special and can’t use with a diffuser
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a BaByliss hairdryer, but am very disappointed. It’s no better than lower priced dryers, and it’s impossible to find a diffuser that fits. I purchased two different recommended diffusers and neither fit. The Black Orchid even scratched the tip of the dryer. So disappointed I missed the return window!! Now stuck with a relatively expensive product I can’t use most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Li

customer_reviews.title: Not for fine hair
customer_reviews.text: I have other hairdryers. This one I bought to keep in the guest bath room for guests to use. It is an excellent hairdryer, but unfortunately not for fine hair. When I dry my hair with this dryer, my hair comes out a little like straw. But for many people it will be great dryer. Would not recommend this dryer if you have a lot of fine hair
customer_reviews.author: cathy k

product_meta.title: BaBylissPRO
product_meta.description:
Style:DryerThe BaBylissPRO Nano Titanium Dryer combines power, speed & design to offer heavy-duty 2000-watt power & lightweight ergonomic handling. Ionic technology means hair dries faster, with less frizz. Features 6 heat/speed settings, a cool shot button, & a concentrator nozzle for a wide range of drying & styling options. Great for all hair types including thick & coarse hair, this blow dryer helps reveal shiny, healthy-looking hair.

BRAND STORY
BaBylissPRO is the world’s leading producer of innovative, high-performance professional styling tools. Chosen by hairdressers, barbers, and clients everywhere, BabylissPRO styling tools are versatile and engineered to last.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
